newsitem.title: FRANCE: Air Gabon names new French cargo executives.
newsitem.headline: Air Gabon names new French cargo executives.

text.p: Air Gabon said it had made two managerial appointments following its decision to run its own French cargo office, effective September 1.
Air Gabon's cargo activities in France are currently run by Air France.
Air Gabon had appointed Francois Bertin and Christophe Baldas to run its cargo office at Paris- Charles de-Gaulle Airport, a spokesman for the African airline said.

Bertin was formerly with Air Lanka' cargo division, based at CDG, while Baldas' previous post was with cargo agents, Prime Air Service and they will replace two cargo personnel seconded from Air France.
Air Gabon operates four weekly Boeing 747 combi flights from Paris to Libreville, each with a cargo capacity of 35 to 40 tonnes.

Two of the flights continue to Johannesburg while weekly stopovers on the service are also made at Marseille, Nice, London-Gatwick and Rome. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44-171-542-7706 Fax+44-171-542-5017
